runs.comm: swing first ball! What a perfect start, swinging away from Warner late to beat the edge of a nervous prod outside off.
slightly shorter this time, Warner hops up on his toes to get on top of the bounce and push the ball into the covers
bottom edged! That seemed to keep a little low, Warner had stayed deep in the crease and the ball took the under edge and rolled through to the 'keeper
Warner off the mark with a drop-and-run to cover
more swing for Aamer, but this started too straight and swung down the leg side to be called wide
beaten on the inside edge! Aamer sent the ball down full and wide of off, luring Watson forward into a drive and then beating the inside edge with swing

got him! Watson goes as Aamer curves one in to hit Watson on the pad, then the bat. Watto doesn't like the decision, and points at his bat as he lingers at the wicket, but he's got to go! That looked like a good decision, pitching in line and would've hit the top of middle. It did hit the bat, but hit pad first.
slashed very high over point! The ball was speared full and wide - a loosener - and he just threw the bat at it

what timing! This was quicker from Shoaib, and Warner just leaned into the shot to push the ball to cover. Didn't look like more than one, but he picked the gap and such was the timing that the ball beats the fielder to the fence!
three in three! Shoaib is copping it from Warner here. Full and wide again, Warner lunges forward to crack a drive right through the covers
four more! Shoaib changes the angle, coming round the wicket and firing down a quick bouncer. But Warner just swivels to pull the ball very fine down to fine leg!

carnage! Warner is taking Shoaib apart with an array of attacking strokes. This time the ball was wide of off and Warner just stayed back and slapped a cut between the two fielders at point and backward point
cheers from the crowd as the last ball is a dot! It was there to be hit, but this time the cut goes straight to the backward point fielder.
dropped into space infront of square on the off side
on the hips, tucked to leg and a quick single
close! Clarke pushed the ball straight to mid-off and Warner wandered out, looking for the single. Clarke sent him back, and he had to dive to make his ground
pushed wide of the cover fielder this time, and they do take a single
full and swinging in, Warner tries to whip the ball away but gets an inside edge straight to short fine leg... who misfields to allow them through for one
another quick single to finish, just pushing into the covers and setting off. The return throw was not accurate, if it had been things could've been interesting
gentle loosener outside off, Clarke times a drive to cover where the fielder dives to his right, getting a hand on the ball to save two runs

what a catch! Clarke went back and tried to drive through cover again, but this time hit the ball uppishly towards Afridi at short cover, who put his hands up to pluck the ball out of the air and set off the celebrations. Pakistan are rocking Australia here, and the crowd have woken up with that wicket!
full, driven back to the bowler who collects in his follow-through
angling in to the pads, Hussey tries to whip the ball through midwicket but finds the fielder
he's been wobbling them in, but this one just held its line as Hussey stood at the crease neither forward nor back, beating the outside edge
angled down to third man for one, and Hussey is off the mark
slashed away for yet another four! Six boundaries from seven deliveries so far for Shoaib, as he sends one down short and wide and is slapped up and over gully
chopped to point, no run...
beats the outside edge! That'll help Shoaib's confidence, he found a little bit of shape away from the bat to beat a defensive prod
fuller this time, driven but mid-off gets round and tumbles over to cut it off
top-edged cut down to third man! That should've been cut off by Razzaq, but he makes an absolute hash of the fielding attempt to allow the ball to get past him. That's just giving away runs...
short and wide again, and Hussey has no trouble slicing this away behind backward point for yet another boundary. Shoaib is proving extremely expensive here...
nudged to leg for a quick single
Razzaq now letting the batsman help himself to a short, wide ball. Really terrible lines and thats hammered away to the point boundary
much better, in the channel outside off and tapped back to the bowler
good line again from Razzaq, he hasn't got the pace to trouble the batsmen but he's just wobbling the ball a bit both ways and beats the edge of the bat with one that moves away
six runs! Hussey comes down the track, not getting to the pitch but just swinging the bat nicely through the line to lift the ball up and way over long-off.
full again, and pushed just back past the bowler for one
nudged to midwicket
offspinner from Afridi, and if I'm picking that then so is Warner as he drives into the covers
another offspinner - or offcutter rather - and its chopped to cover
just outside off again, and driven hard into the covers
topspinner this time, but down the leg side and Warner sweeps to fine leg
coming on with the arm again, but short and cut to point
yorker from Gul straight away, Warner digs it out to point and they scamper through
tight line, good length and Hussey is slightly squared up as he goes back to defend and the ball cuts away from him
again, nice and straight from Gul. Hussey drops the ball very close on the off side and they steal a single, Warner beating the bowler to the other end
full from Gul, Warner clears the front leg and hoicks to leg, sending the ball to wide long-on. Hussey calls for two straight away, they charge through and that's very good running
yorker again, jammed out to deep cover
great, pinpoint yorker from Gul, who is also finding some movement through the air. Hussey swipes down at the ball to send it to mid-on
quicker ball, misdirected down the leg side
slightly shorter this time as Warner backs away, but Afridi tucks Warner up nicely and he can't get it away
swung away on the leg side, midwicket runs round but can't cut off the two. Good running again there, the call coming straight away
carved out to deep cover off the back foot
very quick through the air, full and drifting in, giving Hussey no room to work with outside off
Hussey backs away to leg and pushes through the covers for a single
Warner finds the boundary from the last ball! Another quick ball from Afridi, he cleared the front leg and slammed it straight back down the pitch, along the ground and beating long-off
Hussey wanders away to leg and Gul follows him with a swinging, low full toss. Tapped down to long-on
Warner walks down the track to try and turn the ball into a full toss but ends up yorking himself. Dug out to square leg
well bowled! Gul sends down an inswinging yorker which beats Hussey's swinging blade, shooting between the batsman and the leg stump on its way through to the 'keeper
great stuff from Gul, who is proving very hard to get away. Another yorker, jammed to long-on
full toss, Warner swipes mightily to leg but hits straight to the midwicket fielder
another yorker to finish, Warner gets some of his heavy bat on the ball to send it down to fine leg, just wide of the fielder and so they scamper back for the second
quick, but slightly short and Hussey tries to angle the ball behind point. Umar at backward point dives to make a good stop though
single off the inside edge to leg
backs away and punches through cover

Gone! The frustration was building for Hussey, and he gave himself some room to try and thump the ball down the ground. But Afridi slowed the pace up on that one, and Hussey didn't get to the pitch of it. He went through with the shot all the same, but got right underneath it, long-off circling underneath a swirling chance and clinging on!
very full, driven back to the bowler
quick ball from Afridi, over 70mph, but he's overstepped in making the effort and so a Free hit coming up
wow, very quick from Afridi, over 80mph this time as he sends down a full toss outside off. White gets a good connection but can only send the ball to the cover sweeper
pitching on leg, worked down past the short fine leg fielder but the ball is pulled up before the boundary

bowled 'im! A nothing shot from Warner, just standing outside leg, clearing the left leg and then just thrusting the bat at the ball, more in hope than anything else. The ball, delivered from round the wicket, rushed straight on with the arm to clatter into the stumps!
and he dinks to cover for a sharp single to get off the mark
White tries to work the ball with the spin through midwicket, but finds the fielder
just a touch too straight, White gets across and nudges to short fine leg. Hussey calls him through straight away, though, for a sharp single

nudged towards long-on, Hussey begins to set off for the single but checks his run as he sees Ajmal charging round to cut it off himself. Great piece of fielding from a man not known for his prowess in that department
too straight, nudged off the pad to fine leg
full toss on leg stump, and Hussey cashes in with a great piece of timing and placement to find the boundary with a clip through midwicket. He's up and running now
nudged behind square on the leg side
White's not looking to comfortable, just thrusting his leg out and stabbing at the ball. Lucky to get anything on that. Oohs and aahs from the fielders
fuller this time, driven to long-on
Hussey gets across to off stump and finds a single to short fine leg
half-volley outside off, driven to long-off
awkwardly prodded back to the bowler
a touch of width outside off, and White guides the ball off the face of the bat to third man
White backs away to leg this time, Ajmal follows him and all he can do is smack it back to the bowler
that must be quite a piece of willow in White's hands! He's just swung at a straight ball, didn't seem to hit it that well but got enough on it to get the ball across the boundary at midwicket!
that's the shot he was looking for the ball before! White picks a straight ball up over square leg for a huge six. There's the pressure release!
Aamer strikes Hussey on the pad first ball, but that's sliding well down the leg side and the appeal is quickly quashed

boom boom! Another great catch from Afridi, this one even better than the first, and we get the same celebration that he gave in taking that catch at The Oval in 2009 - legs apart, hands up and fingers pointing, just adoring the adulation as the crowd scream their approval. White had just looked to chip a full ball over mid-off, but Afridi had other ideas!
boundary to follow, it's all action now! Aamer slips one down the leg side and Hussey just gets a little tickle on the ball to send it down to fine leg
Aamer shapes one in to his pads once again, and Hussey is perhaps beaten for pace as the ball thumps into the pad. Going down leg again
tapped to cover and they set off immediately for the single
how has that gone for four? Smith just whipped the ball through midwicket, looked like a single at most but it had the beating of the fielder and raced away to the boundary
attempted reverse-sweep from Hussey, the shot was on as the ball spun away from him, but he couldn't get bat on it. Ajmal gives him a good stare after that shot
much quicker, the ball strikes the pad and goes to fine leg
simply too good for Smith, Ajmal sends down a doosra which actually turns substantially away from the bat. Smith was aiming to sweep to leg, but completely lost sight of that... Didn't pick it at all
too short this time, slapped away behind point
full toss, but hammered straight to extra cover
full and fast, again he finds cover but they take a single
great shot! He played a few of those against England, and he's nailed one here as well. Smith just opens up, clearing the left leg and scything the ball through cover, all along the ground, for four
again he sends the front foot to leg, but Aamer goes straighter this time and also pulls the length back, so just the one
low full toss from Aamer, Hussey chips it to leg and picks up a boundary at midwicket!
tip-and-run as he sends the ball to cover. Call came straight away

bowled! Smith goes! That was a horrible, ungainly mow across the line to a length ball, Smith misses completely and the ball smashes into the top of the middle and leg stumps. Does that swing the match for Pakistan? Hussey is the man they want
great yorker to start, Paine digs it out to mid-off and takes a single
Paine shuffles across to off, is struck on the pad as Gul sends one snaking in full. That was slipping down leg though, and they take a leg-bye to get Hussey on strike

cleaned him up! The crowd roar, the fielders mob the bowler! Gul sends down the perfect yorker, and Mike Hussey's leg stump is sent cartwheeling! That's the wicket Pakistan wanted. That should taste real sweet after what he did to them at the World Twenty20
jams a yorker out to midwicket, they take a sharp second
gets the yorker just wrong and it comes out a low full toss, which is drilled down to long-on
Paine goes down to scoop over the 'keeper, but Gul sends down a full toss outside off and he can't lay bat on it!

the stumps are shattered! Gul is on fire here, Paine goes across his stumps but Gul spears in an inswinging yorker to send the leg stump spinning! If Australia had a chance before this over, Gul has almost certainly done enough to win this game now
fired down leg, too far and that's called wide

stumped! Johnson is left lying on the turf as Pakistan celebrate! He jumped out of the crease as Ajmal sent down a quicker one, and just ran past the ball. Kamran completed a smart stumping in a flash, Johnson swung round and tumbled over as he tried to get back to the crease, but to no avail. Just one wicket needed now
too good for Tait, he had no idea at all as Ajmal sent down the doosra. Big swing outside off connects with fresh air

well, that has flown miles over wide long-on! Ajmal tosses one up on leg stump, Tait comes down the track and just swings through the line - he has no idea which way it's turning - and connects handsomely.
doosra again, Tait doesn't pick it as he charges down the track and Kamran has the bails off in a split second! Pakistan win the first Twenty20, and the crowd are absolutely loving this
